Author: lonesomestranger
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: More detailed info about Bitizens moving to TRON  We are migrating the game to TRON — here’s what you need to know  It is safe to say that BitGuild would not exist without the Ethereum network. When we first started this project, Ethereum’s innovations in smart contracts and decentralized applications made it possible for us to become what we are today. But the crypto industry is fast evolving, led by new technologies and platforms that are better at resolving specific issues and meeting the needs of the growing crypto community.  Read more: https://medium.com/the-notice-board/bitizens-is-moving-to-tron-71e5c9a39ef

Author: lonesomestranger
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: PLAT Is Migrating to TRON - ERC20 PLAT to the new TRC20 PLAT  BitGuild is completing the cycle by migrating PLAT, BitGuild’s utility token, to the TRON network. Now, PLAT works as a measure of the success of BitGuild, and a portion of the revenue of all BitGuild products will be used to buy back and burn PLAT, shortening supply and increasing value.  Read more: https://medium.com/the-notice-board/plat-is-migrating-to-tron-cf64909bfba3

Author: lonesomestranger
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: How to migrate your ERC20 PLAT to TRON  As previously announced, BitGuild is completing a cycle that started in December, when we migrated our flagship game, Bitizens, to the TRON network. Starting on May 10th, you will be able to migrate your ERC20 PLAT to the TRON Network. This process will take place on the BitGuild Portal, and only takes a few minutes to complete.  Get more info here: https://medium.com/the-notice-board/how-to-migrate-your-erc20-plat-to-tron-e926059f0bd5

Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: Getting Comfortable with Token Standards An in-depth comparison between TRX10 and TRX20, and how they relate to ICOs  Token nomenclature can get confusing, and it can be hard to keep up with the seemingly ever-evolving standards. In this TRON focused post, I’ll be giving you a technical overview of both the TRX10 and TRX20 tokens, as well as their purpose in relation to ICOs. By the end, you should have a much deeper understanding of not just these two types of TRX tokens, but how cryptocurrency tokens and smart contracts work in general.  Read more: https://medium.com/the-notice-board/getting-comfortable-with-token-standards-a16a333babac

Author: TOM47
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: Three Great Games Coming to the Ethereum Blockchain https://medium.com/the-notice-board/three-great-games-coming-to-the-ethereum-blockchain-b90021f8806b  At BitGuild, a lot of time has been spent finding games built on the Ethereum network. While there are a lot of games out there, a lot of them are not as interactive as traditional games. Some are idle or simply collectibles attempting to follow in the success of CryptoKitties. However, we’ve found that if you dig deep enough, you can find several games that are appealing to your more traditionally focused gamer.

You may have already heard about our new fishing game, but just in case you haven’t, here’s a little introduction:  When you moved to Bitropolis, you brought with you an old tube-TV. Author: LV5ME
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: CryptoDungeons A look into the first exclusive partner game on BitGuild  At BitGuild, it’s important for us to work with indie developers that are willing to challenge themselves and create unique experiences on the blockchain. That’s why we were thrilled to add CryptoDungeons—a brand new RPG experience on the blockchain—to our growing portfolio of games.  The game is an ambitious project with a lot of potential for growth and might even be the purest RPG game we’ve seen in the blockchain world in terms of its base mechanics. We talked to Angelo Neves Bastos, Front-End Developer at CryptoDungeons, and found out why this game is set to change things for RPGs.  https://medium.com/the-notice-board/dev-spotlight-cryptodungeons-913fe1624b8b

Author: Jekwizor
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: Dev Spotlight: CryptoDungeons A look into the first exclusive partner game on BitGuild https://medium.com/the-notice-board/dev-spotlight-cryptodungeons-913fe1624b8b  At BitGuild, it’s important for us to work with indie developers that are willing to challenge themselves and create unique experiences on the blockchain. That’s why we were thrilled to add CryptoDungeons—a brand new RPG experience on the blockchain—to our growing portfolio of games.  The game is an ambitious project with a lot of potential for growth and might even be the purest RPG game we’ve seen in the blockchain world in terms of its base mechanics. We talked to Angelo Neves Bastos, Front-End Developer at CryptoDungeons, and found out why this game is set to change things for RPGs.

Author: lonesomestranger
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: Panel - Blockchain in Gaming - WBCSG2018  For your viewing pleasure!!! Watch this panel discussion featuring CEO @swaysnt at #WBSSingapore2018: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H4-Z17GuDKA&feature=youtu.be  About WBCSG 2018: World Blockchain Conference powered by GMGC is a two-day technology conference gathering more than 1,000 Industry experts, leaders, innovators and professionals. The 2nd Blockchain & Game Conference was hosted at the Pan Pacific Singapore on July 17-18, 2018.  About GMGC: Headquartered in Beijing, the Global Mobile Game Confederation (GMGC) is an international platform for game companies to create lasting partnerships and gain access to new markets. GMGC works closely with mobile developers, publishers, investors, distributors, and other industry related companies to facilitate collaboration, market growth, and understanding.

Author: lonesomestranger
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: Behavioral Mining: Blockchain’s New Rocket Fuel (Part 1) How behavioral mining will change the way we create crypto companies and dApps  New Bitcoins come into existence through mining. Most people who have done any research on blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies know this. I mean, it’s not that hard to understand, right?. There are a bunch of warehouses out there with computers and fans running 24/7 to pump out those beautiful new Bitcoins into the world. Pretty simple?  Read full story: https://medium.com/the-notice-board/behavioral-mining-blockchains-new-rocket-fuel-part-1-ca65a7d82d22

Author: LV5ME
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: An excellent and informative article, it was interesting to read it, and it's also important to see how the team is doing its job and how to find new ways, and experiment, and this is all the guarantee of good success. At BitGuild, we like to use the right tools for each project and get as much utility out of them as we can. While this article shows a way to use Apollo and GraphQL without Redux on the server, we still believe that Redux is a valuable state management pattern… but if there’s a way to simplify and streamline application state, you can bet we’ll be on it!

Author: lonesomestranger
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: Silent But Deadly: The Mystery of Ethereum Gas Prices  Why are ETH gas prices so high? Gas prices on the Ethereum Network are a hot topic these days — and that’s understandable when we see fees escalate far beyond what’s reasonable to pay for a single transaction. Gas prices can fluctuate between being low and affordable to (relatively) high — especially if you’re only attempting to buy something that’s equivalent to $10. This would be like filling up your car at a gas station for $3/gal and next week you’re filling up at $6/gal. Not an ideal economy.  Read full story on Medium: https://medium.com/the-notice-board/silent-but-deadly-the-mystery-of-ethereum-gas-prices-d9c19b86ce71

Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: A Look at BitGuild’s Marketplace - How we’re planning to build the “Steam Market for blockchain game items”  Hail Guildmates!  Today, I’ll talk a bit about its current state and our vision for its future. The marketplace beta is part of BitGuild’s vision for gamers to fully own their in-game items on the blockchain. This entails the ability to freely sell and buy items in an open market. As most gamers already know, there are similar marketplaces for in-game items off the blockchain, most notably Steam’s.  Read full story on Medium: https://medium.com/the-notice-board/a-look-at-bitguilds-marketplace-bb8f815a5982

Body: Dev Spotlight: Blockchain Cuties  Is Blockchain Cuties just another crypto pet game? We don’t think so.  You might have heard of Blockchain Cuties, a game that allows you to collect, breed, and battle adorable little cuties on the blockchain. What you don’t know is that this is not just another crypto pet game.  Since the game will be available on our portal in a few weeks (!!!) we decided to have a little chat with one of the developers on the team, Davis Toliashvili, and discuss why the game is so unique compared to other games in this space. Author: JagerBeen
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: MESSAGE FROM THE BITGUILD TEAM:  We are aiming to make BitGuild a discovery platform where players can find today’s best blockchain games, and learn about amazing games coming out in the future. As such our focus right now is on our platform and content, and we want to keep comments on Telegram focused on those as well. Up to this point, we have some successes (early introduction of other languages, starting to implement 3rd party games) and also missteps (halt Magic Academy's live service to improve the experience based on community feedback). Along the way, community members have been submitting useful comments and delivering critical feedback. We really appreciate it, and the community’s assistance has been integral in our moving forward. At the moment, BitGuild has many pieces moving in parallel, some of which we cannot discuss at this time. Unfortunately, comments focusing on exchanges and the value of PLAT have detracted from our attempts to create a wholesome forum for discussion—and at times have provided a negative experience to our true community members who continue supporting our vision of a blockchain gaming platform. Going forward, if you have questions about exchanges or the value of PLAT, do not post them in the public channel. Please PM our moderators, and they will provide you with the correct information. Members who do not follow this rule might be muted or banned.  Of course, the last time it has become very difficult to get to the good stock exchanges, but still we will believe and hope that the team will be able to please us in the near future with popular exchanges and the main excellent product. Good luck to the team in their work.

Author: filsid
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: BitGuild Portal — Sprint #2  A look at what we’re working on, and what’s to come    A week ago we launched what we called portal v0 — an initial version that included several key elements such as PLAT converter, item inventory, game catalogue, chat, and localizations. Since then, our the first game integration Ether Online has gone on to be the top grossing game on the Ethereum blockchain—and DappRadar doesn’t even show PLAT spent. For this post, we wanted to share a quick update on our current progress and plans going forward.  In the past week, we have been focusing on improving and polishing the portal, migrating to the new infrastructure and deployment pipelines, and more. Some of the key changes include new chatrooms for different languages, richer analytics, and upcoming Ether Online airdrop functionality.  Most of these things are scheduled to go live today, along with our second game integration: Magic Academy! This is an exclusive game for the BitGuild portal created in partnership with another great studio. Yeah, we move fast.  Here’s a sneak peek of what to expect next: *Three more game integrations we’re working on with our new partners Axie Infinity, Eth.Town and Mythereum.  *Better mobile support. We realize that mobile adoption for Ethereum wallets is on the rise, and more and more players are using apps like Cypher and Trust Wallet to play crypto games. With that in mind, we’re going to focus on optimizing the mobile user experience and work with game developers to ensure that as many games as possible can be played on mobile.  *Marketplace! We’re currently working on our own marketplace for ERC721 tokens that will use PLAT as the main currency. All the games on the portal will benefit from this marketplace by default; no need to build your own if you integrate with us!  In other exciting news, we welcomed two new members to our team this week! We’re thrilled to have Shain and Calvin (both Senior Engineers) on board to help us build a new home for cryptogamers. We also moved to the new office in San Francisco’s Mission District, so if you’re in the area, come say hi!  https://medium.com/the-notice-board/bitguild-portal-sprint-2-abff06e4fadf

Author: Kirilp
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: The Dual-Audience Dilemma: Appealing to Both Traditional and Crypto Gamers https://medium.com/the-notice-board/the-dual-audience-dilemma-appealing-to-both-traditional-and-crypto-gamers-d75c584de84e  Blockchain gaming is on the rise, there’s no dispute, and this new technology has all the fixin’s to revolutionize our dear gaming industry.  Like so many ideas or innovations before it, such as the transition to online services and Free-to-Play models, blockchain and crypto are going to be making an impact on games as we know them today — and if BitGuild has anything to say on the matter, it’ll be a change for the better.  There’s an inherent challenge to face though, because currently, blockchain games aren’t really games as your typical player would define them. Early blockchain titles such as CryptoCountries and CryptoKitties are shining examples of new ideas springing forth from the trenches in order to make an early impact, but can fall short in the eyes of someone like a seasoned console gamer.  These types of games have garnered a fair amount of popularity in enthusiast communities. However, while these new blockchain titles are doing something that hasn’t really been done before, and are quite profitable while doing so, daily active users are at relatively low number when compared to traditional gaming spaces. That’s hardly going to make much of an impact on gaming as a whole.  This isn’t because the games are bad, per se. It’s an expectations issue resulting from the fact that traditional gaming audiences and crypto gaming audiences are currently two very different groups.  Today’s mainstream gamer knows what to expect from their chosen experiences — they want good stories, tight and gratifying gameplay, and charming graphics. They generally believe games should be free, or have a fixed cost, optionally supplemented with DLC or cosmetic microtransactions. The type of games they play have roots reaching as far back as the days of coin operated arcade machines, and represent a natural progression based on the same concepts that were seen back then. This type of gamer isn’t generally accustomed to an entire genre based around the idea of gamified transactions that have real world value — it’s just too different!  Cryptogamers on the other hand, are currently represented by an audience that primarily comes from cryptocurrency enthusiasts — people fascinated with a new technology that facilitates true item ownership in online games. They play these games for a chance to win cryptocurrency prize pools, the main goal being to get higher returns than what they spent on the game in the first place. Player counts are still low, yet average amount spent per user is relatively high when comparing with more traditional formats, such as PC, Console, and Mobile platforms.  At BitGuild we believe there is room for both types of players, and our ultimate goal is to slowly bring the two together as we release innovative and fresh experiences. We aim to provide playable blockchain titles in a wide variety of flavors — hopefully offering up something appetizing for gamers from all walks of life.  Though early titles to make their debut on BitGuild, such as Ether Online and Magic Academy, are strictly in the “crypto” genre, we have several other titles in the pipes for people who are more interested in more traditional gameplay experiences.  Games such as Mythereum, a trading card game, are going to be among the first blockchain games that truly appeal to current core gamers. It’s akin to something like Hearthstone — the most striking difference being how assets are handled. In most current major digital card games, you don’t truly own your cards, and trading is restricted — all in an effort to promote more sales instead of creating a compelling ecosystem that will in itself drive sales. In Mythereum, you truly own your cards, and are free to buy, sell, or trade them as you please.  We also have ETH.Town coming soon, and while this title veers more towards the crypto side of the gaming spectrum, it incorporates a number of unique and innovative features that are aimed at melding classic gameplay systems with elements of newer crypto and trading focused titles.  As we progress, we hope to gradually merge the two groups of gamers, creating an audience and ecosystem that will pave the way for future generations of blockchain games to thrive in.  We invite you all to start playing games on www.bitguild.com right now! You should also consider joining the community on our official Discord Server, where you’ll be able to keep up with all the latest news, interact with the team, offer feedback, participate in aidrops & giveaways, and more!

Author: lonesomestranger
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: Hey folks! Bitguild talk about how Free-to-Play affects indie developers, and why blockchain is set to tip the scales.  Few can argue the fervor with which Free-to-Play overtook the video gaming industry just a few years ago. We saw previously established norms for what a video game should be — and how much it should cost — come crumbling down seemingly overnight. Hundreds of completely free games with wildly varying degrees of quality hit the market, first on mobile devices, and later seeping into both console and PC ecosystems as well. This has helped introduce video games to a much wider audience, but it is also slowly shifting the scene into something scarcely recognizable to the original core audience.  Read full article on Medium https://medium.com/the-notice-board/f2p-is-bringing-devs-down-heres-why-de6e24c0906f

Author: thilinanamal
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: Gaming is one of the oldest shapes of fun, and the video game filed has developed amazingly over the past ten years. With the rising demand for entertainment, this promises to be a field that has the power for long-run progress, not just to meet the personal need for fun or entertainment, but also as a business equipment that brings in remarkable profit for parties attached. However, the usual gaming field is presently containing a range of downsides that restrict the ability of players. For instance, gamers don't have real ownership of their game assets and character. these virtual assets are saved on the company's game server, so that the creators can terminate any profiles, for every reason and at any period, without sending any notice. In addition, most internet video games differ depending on servers and regions, so differences in the systems progress policies and local rule decreased the worldwide cooperation in video games.

Author: negancoin
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: That website is allowing to play traditional PC game online, they upload games on cloud ( servers ) which makes those games run on their servers and accessible online without you need to install them. So it has nothing to do with blockchain games which refer to games that run on blockchain like Cryptokitties!  However, after some research I assume that you saw their ICO project playkey.io and thought that those game are blockchain games. I checked it, but the concept is still has nothing to with blockchain games, they just want to expand that cloud gaming by selling some sort servers to people around the world to build some kinda of decentralized cloud ( traditional decentralized ). So it's still a cloud that contains traditional games.

Author: negancoin
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: BitGuild platform will open to 3rd party developers in 2018 Q3, if you are a game developer, you will be able to list your game to the platform and get PLAT token as payment when players make purchase inside your game ( buy items )  To get your game listed on the platform, there are some requirements: - Utilize blockchain and smart contract - Accept PLAT AS THE ONLY PAYMENT OPTION - Tokenize game assets and store them in players wallets - Allow for the buying/selling/trading of in-game assets

Author: TOM47
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: New Bi-Fungible Tokens: Redefining Asset Ownership. https://medium.com/@BitGuild/new-bi-fungible-tokens-redefining-asset-ownership-4ca040485122 It’s no secret that we’re bringing gaming and blockchain together in a big way, primarily through the implementation of non-fungible tokens into the core of the BitGuild platform.  Players are able to own, trade, buy, or sell their in-game assets freely, with no restrictions. The sword you’ve worked so hard for in your favorite game is truly yours to do with as you wish.  This gives way to a slew of interesting and innovative new ways to think about game design, and we’re already seeing the dawn of a new age in gaming.  But some of you want more — and we hear your pleas!  Announcing the BitGuild Bi-Fungible Tokenized Items Program!

Author: Doctor-Coin
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: Well, this is not all; they have also very experienced and competent advisors:  Brock Pierce Chairman, The Bitcoin Foundation; Co-founder, Blockchain Capital, Block.one Brock Pierce is an entrepreneur and venture capitalist with an extensive track record of founding, advising, and investing in disruptive businesses. He is a pioneer in the digital currency realms of both gaming and blockchain technology. He founded IGE and IMI, which were world leaders in digital currency trading for video games as well as ZAM, one of the world’s largest media properties for gamers. He is an early investor in Bitcoin and was one of the largest investors in the Ethereum crowdsale.  Justin Sun Founder, TRON Justin Sun is the founder of TRON and the CallMe app. He was listed on the Forbes 30 under 30 list three times between 2015 and 2017. He previously served as the Chief Representative in Greater China for Ripple Labs.  Kevin Chou Chairman & CEO, KSV eSports Kevin is the Chairman and co-founder of KSV eSports, an eSports company bridging Silicon Valley technology savvy and Korean gaming preeminence. Previously, Kevin was CEO and co-founder of Kabam, a leader in developing console-quality mobile games which was sold for nearly $1 billion to Netmarble, 21st Century FOX, and GAEA. Kevin serves on the Board of Trustees at UC Berkeley.  Leo Wang Founding Partner, PreAngel Leo is founding partner of the PreAngel Fund, which currently manages over 1 billion CNY in assets and has invested in over 300 startups from the US and China. PreAngel entered the cryptocurrency market in 2014, and is an angel investor in companies like NEO and ObEN PAI.  Yi Shi Chairman, oBike, DotC United Group Yi is the founder and CEO of technology company DotC United Group. The company owns mobile advertising platform Avazu, app developer DotC and data business intelligence platform Noogenesis. Yi Shi has been recognized three times by Forbes as one of China and Asia’s 30 under 30 entrepreneurs as well as Fortune China’s 40 under 40. He also serves as chairman and founding investor of oBike, the Southeast Asian-based bike sharing platform.  and finally The 2100 Fund Club  The 2100 Club Fund is a blockchain investment fund and incubator founded by FunCity Capital, Binance, and other strategic partners.

Author: Doctor-Coin
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: Jared Psigoda CEO Prior to founding BitGuild, Jared was the co-founder and CEO of Reality Squared Games (R2Games)  Curtis Chiu COO With over 17+ years of game industry experience, Curtis’ skillset spans across development, publishing, and operations over every major gaming platform. He has worked with various top gaming companies in the US and Asia as an executive producer and product manager such as Kabam, Outspark, Sega, and Konami.  Mikhail Larionov CTO Mikhail is a full-stack product and engineering leader with over a decade of experience in gaming and cryptocurrencies. Prior to BitGuild, Mikhail led the Messenger Platform engineering team at Facebook, overseeing the product from inception to public launch. Previously, he worked at The Walt Disney Company as a product lead on Playdom games such as Gardens of Time.  Sean Keith Vice President, Business Development Sean has a wealth of experience in business development with a focus on Asian markets. He entered the gaming industry as Director of International Business Development for Reality Squared Games. Later, Sean went on to work for FoxNext, where he was responsible for leveraging FOX IP to create, foster, and execute strategic partnerships with game developers and publishers.

Author: negancoin
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: If he did a comparison, he should provide details. Saying I have compared and analyzed two game projects between Refereum and Bitguild and this is a pretty good, make no sense ! First of all, Refereum provides referrals on the blockchain that rewards you for create, play, watch gaming for traditional game. and they actually doing a good job and if you google them, you will find that lots of gamers are exciting about their service. On other hand, BitGuild want actually to create blockchain games and because those type games are different of traditional one, you can actually exchange item between games which is new concept.  So , those two projects is quite different, however if we compare them as project, Refereum is running now while Bitguild is still an idea on paper, they have no code on github, no details on their game, I saw user asked them " Are the games going to be like tron dogs? ", admin answer was : " We're holding off on divulging details regarding our debut game.  ", therefore I see that a big weakness of BitGuild, because we don't know the quality of game that they are going to develop ! and they refuse to give details.

Author: Doctor-Coin
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: General Informations about BitGuild  BitGuild aims to host the best blockchain games and the largest blockchain gamer community online.  About PLAT:  Games All games utilize smart contract technology, accept PLAT, and feature tokenized game items that are player-owned and tradeable.  Marketplace Virtual assets created on the BitGuild platform can be bought and sold for PLAT on the Auction House. Auctions are decentralized and built using smart contracts.  Transactions Players can easily buy games, PLAT, and content with no added costs. Devs avoid hidden fees, fraud, and receive quick payments.  Community The community provides a place that fosters player-to-player and player-to-developer interaction. The goal is to create the largest international gaming community in the world.  Design House Developers will be able to crowdsource game funding, game design, and game content transparently by utilizing PLAT.  Wallet Unlike traditional cryptocurrency wallets, BitGuild's wallet allows for the display of non-fungible tokens (such as game items and equipment).

Author: Gpuhog
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: This is interesting.  Currency from one user can be converted to PLAT for sale to another user in another game.  This kind of transaction happens a lot today in gaming.  Some players of MMOs will offer trading of currency from the game they are playing for another game they are considering playing.  Usually, a different player will agree to such a trade and give them an equivalent currency value in exchange.  All this trading is done without a proper platform to make the process easier.  Actually, gold farmers are very common but it's nothing short of a clean exchange that one would expect.  I think PLAT can fill this void and much more once the value of a PLAT is established and accepted by gamers.  I'll keep an eye on this project.

Author: Jekwizor
Title: [ANN][ICO] 🚀 BitGuild 🚀 Blockchain gaming platform
Body: Behind The Guild — Part I  Blockchain and Crypto games are a new and wild beast. Every few weeks, we are seeing a fresh generation of titles, iterating on what came before, exploring new concepts, and shaping the picture of things to come. BitGuild, a dedicated blockchain gaming platform, is well set to harness this beast. Building the future of games is no small task. It requires a clear vision, even if the end goal is still unclear. BitGuild is ready to clarify this, and step into the forefront of the blockchain gaming industry.  https://medium.com/the-notice-board/behind-the-guild-part-i-bb15f973beb
